p: With cost efficiency and versatility among its attributes, polylactic acid (PLA) presents a new kind of biodegradable substance, which is manufactured from sustainable plant materials such as corn starch and sugar beets [ 56, 57], and obtained FDA certification approving food-contact utilization [ 58]. However, no antimicrobial effect is evident in the pure PLA film [ 59]. As a natural, linear and aliphatic polyester, PLA films exhibit a high level of transparency and extremely water resistant [ 59, 60, 61]. They are frequently employed to enhance food preservation and prolong the storage life of fresh produce [ 57, 59, 60, 61].
